result.execSummary:
The defendant Nolan R Tuma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED TO ALL COSTS. PAID IN FULL. Buy Money to be forwarded to Waukesha Sheriff's Dept. (Drug Metro)
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - (nonworking hours) FORTHWITH. 1st 9 months STRAIGHT TIME, Last 3 months with Huber. Credit for 65 days served. Defendant to report to Day Report Center for 45 days immediately upon completion of Condition Time.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nolan R Tuma in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher R Smith.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in. Parties proceed to sentencing. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 7 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 4 years)  Stayed for 5 years  Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 - apply bail 
- Buy Money of $185.00  - apply bail
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00  - apply bail
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores). DNA Sample if not yet provided.
- Defendant to report to Day Report Center for 45 days upon completion of condition time.  
- 1 year Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH - 1st 9 months straight time, last 3 months with huber - credit for 65 days.
Plea and sentencing, March 11, 2015.

Defendant Nolan R Tuma in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher R Smith.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date next week for a plea/sentencing. Court grants request and will set the matter over.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Nolan R Tuma in court. Atty. Peter D. Ploetz did not appear - car trouble.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court grants the motion for Atty. Ploetz to withdraw. Court will give the defendant 30 days to find additional counsel. WCS letter addressed. State requests bail be increased by another $10,000.00 in addition to the bail already posted. Court will not impose bail at this time. Court will give the defendant another date in a few weeks to give him a chance to appear with new counsel. Court orders capias quashed. Court will set another date in a week. Copy of letter from Lakeshore Medical Clinic given to the State.  Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.
